pages.text: The $(item)Cloud Interface$() is a gateway to your digital cycle storage.$(br)$(br)It allows you to upload generated cycles to a global "Cloud" account. These cycles are stored in the world data, meaning they are accessible from any other Cloud Interface, anywhere and in any dimension.
Provides access to the global Cycle Network.

pages.title: I/O Configuration
pages.text: The block has specific directional logic:$(br)$(br)$(li)$(l)Back Input:$() Connect a Generator or Network Cable here to $(2)UPLOAD$() cycles to the cloud.$(li)$(l)Output Sides:$() Any other side will $(4)DOWNLOAD$() cycles from the cloud to power adjacent machines.

pages.title: Team Storage
pages.text: Cloud storage is automatically keyed to your account.$(br)$(br)If you join a $(l)Team$() (via FTB Teams or Vanilla), your interface will instantly switch to the Team's shared storage pool.$(br)$(br)This allows all party members to contribute to and withdraw from the same energy source.

pages.title: Offline Access
pages.text: Unlike personal inventory, the Cloud Interface works via $(l)Global Saved Data$().$(br)$(br)This means automation will continue to run and process cycles even if the owner is offline, provided the chunk is loaded.
